Trade/Device Name(s): BD Phoenix™M Automated Microbiology System - Amoxicillin-clavulanate (0.5/0.25 - 32/16 µg/mL)
BD Phoenix™M Automated Microbiology System - Ampicillin-sulbactam (0.5/0.25 - 32/16 µg/mL)
BD Phoenix™M Automated Microbiology System - Ticarcillin (1-128 µg/mL)
Regulation Name(s): Fully Automated Short-Term Incubation Cycle Antimicrobial Susceptibility Devices
Specimen Type(s): Isolates from pure culture of aerobic and facultative anaerobic Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for BD Phoenix Automated Microbiology System panels for Amoxicillin-clavulanate, Ampicillin-sulbactam, and Ticarcillin antimicrobial susceptibility testing
Indications for Use Summary: In vitro quantitative determination of antimicrobial susceptibility (MIC) of most Gram-negative aerobic/facultative anaerobic bacteria (Enterobacteriaceae, Non-Enterobacteriaceae) and most Gram-positive bacteria (Staphylococcus, Enterococcus, Streptococcus) isolates from pure culture
